title: Research Data Manager- Analytics
description:
Overview
St. John's Riverside Hospital is a leader in providing the highest quality, compassionate health care utilizing the latest, state-of-the-art medical technology. Serving the Westchester community from Yonkers to the river town communities of Hastings-on-Hudson, Ardsley, Dobbs Ferry and Irvington, St. John's Riverside has been and continues to be a unique and comprehensive network of medical professionals dedicated to a tradition of service that spans generations.
¬†
St. John‚Äôs has been an integral part of the community since the 1890's and its‚Äô commitment to provide the community with the most advanced medical services available continues to be the hospitals‚Äô vision, mission and value. St. John's Riverside Hospital built itself around an early foundation of nursing and community service. In 1894, the Cochran School of Nursing, the oldest hospital-based school of nursing in the metropolitan area, was founded, thus making the St. John's Nursing Staff more than just the backbone of the hospital, but the heart and soul. St. John‚Äôs dedicated nurses give superior attention to those who need it most with a strong emphasis on patient and family-focused nursing care.¬†¬†¬†
¬†
St. John‚Äôs Riverside Hospital staff is committed to making life better for all patients. The hospital continues to elevate the services provided with the goal of increasing the quality of life for all who entrust St. John's Riverside Hospital to their care.
¬†
Personalized care together with advanced technology is what it means to be Community Strong
Responsibilities
This position reports to our health equity chairs and will compile, validate, and analyze statistical reports within St. John‚Äôs Riverside Hospital (SJRH), Yonkers and Westchester County. Responsible for managing multiple projects within the organization that aim to impact health equity and health outcomes. This position will support health equity goals of the hospital‚Äôs Community Service Plan related to Black Maternal and Infant Health. Research Data Manager may assist with projects relating to Health Equity readiness within the various aspects of the hospital.
¬†
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES‚Ä¢ Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and distribute ongoing reports.‚Ä¢ Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases.‚Ä¢ Supports development of Community Service Plan and monitor progress.‚Ä¢ Identify trends and recommend new ways to impact health disparities and health equity in the community.‚Ä¢ Responsible for bi-monthly ‚Äònews flashes‚Äô to community partners, the hospital, and CARES Committee members about activities of the CARES Committee.‚Ä¢ Represent the hospital at community events to promote the Black Maternal Health initiative and support other health equity initiatives throughout the system. ‚Ä¢ Provide outreach and limited patient navigation services to Black birthing people who are undecided about delivering at SJRH to remove obstacles and link new mothers (and families) to community resources. Also provide limited patient navigation services to individuals from populations represented within the hospital‚Äôs service area that may need additional support to attain positive health outcomes. ‚Ä¢ Support efforts to have SJRH maternal health grants and community partners working together with Black Maternal Center to improve birth outcomes.‚Ä¢ Supports the health equity goals of the Hospital‚Äôs Community Service Plan and Community Health Needs Assessment (CHNA) through collection and analysis of data relating to those plans and to other foci of the health equity program. ‚Ä¢ Sets up committee meetings; emails members and takes minutes.‚Ä¢ Collaborate with chairs of health equity committee to implement and evaluate improvement strategies.‚Ä¢ Compiles various reports for presentation to senior management.‚Ä¢ Performs other tasks necessary.
Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Excellent communication skills. Candidates must have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Power BI is a plus. Candidate representing populations of interest relating to health equity in our service area preferred.Able to meet deadlines, multi-task, and work within time constraints.

Overview

St. John's Riverside Hospital is a leader in providing the highest quality, compassionate health care utilizing the latest, state-of-the-art medical technology. Serving the Westchester community from Yonkers to the river town communities of Hastings-on-Hudson, Ardsley, Dobbs Ferry and Irvington, St. John's Riverside has been and continues to be a unique and comprehensive network of medical professionals dedicated to a tradition of service that spans generations.

¬†

St. John‚Äôs has been an integral part of the community since the 1890's and its‚Äô commitment to provide the community with the most advanced medical services available continues to be the hospitals‚Äô vision, mission and value. St. John's Riverside Hospital built itself around an early foundation of nursing and community service. In 1894, the Cochran School of Nursing, the oldest hospital-based school of nursing in the metropolitan area, was founded, thus making the St. John's Nursing Staff more than just the backbone of the hospital, but the heart and soul. St. John‚Äôs dedicated nurses give superior attention to those who need it most with a strong emphasis on patient and family-focused nursing care.¬†¬†¬†

¬†

St. John‚Äôs Riverside Hospital staff is committed to making life better for all patients. The hospital continues to elevate the services provided with the goal of increasing the quality of life for all who entrust St. John's Riverside Hospital to their care.

¬†

Personalized care together with advanced technology is what it means to be Community Strong

Responsibilities

This position reports to our health equity chairs and will compile, validate, and analyze statistical reports within St. John‚Äôs Riverside Hospital (SJRH), Yonkers and Westchester County. Responsible for managing multiple projects within the organization that aim to impact health equity and health outcomes. This position will support health equity goals of the hospital‚Äôs Community Service Plan related to Black Maternal and Infant Health. Research Data Manager may assist with projects relating to Health Equity readiness within the various aspects of the hospital.

¬†

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES‚Ä¢ Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and distribute ongoing reports.‚Ä¢ Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases.‚Ä¢ Supports development of Community Service Plan and monitor progress.‚Ä¢ Identify trends and recommend new ways to impact health disparities and health equity in the community.‚Ä¢ Responsible for bi-monthly ‚Äònews flashes‚Äô to community partners, the hospital, and CARES Committee members about activities of the CARES Committee.‚Ä¢ Represent the hospital at community events to promote the Black Maternal Health initiative and support other health equity initiatives throughout the system. ‚Ä¢ Provide outreach and limited patient navigation services to Black birthing people who are undecided about delivering at SJRH to remove obstacles and link new mothers (and families) to community resources. Also provide limited patient navigation services to individuals from populations represented within the hospital‚Äôs service area that may need additional support to attain positive health outcomes. ‚Ä¢ Support efforts to have SJRH maternal health grants and community partners working together with Black Maternal Center to improve birth outcomes.‚Ä¢ Supports the health equity goals of the Hospital‚Äôs Community Service Plan and Community Health Needs Assessment (CHNA) through collection and analysis of data relating to those plans and to other foci of the health equity program. ‚Ä¢ Sets up committee meetings; emails members and takes minutes.‚Ä¢ Collaborate with chairs of health equity committee to implement and evaluate improvement strategies.‚Ä¢ Compiles various reports for presentation to senior management.‚Ä¢ Performs other tasks necessary.

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Excellent communication skills. Candidates must have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Power BI is a plus. Candidate representing populations of interest relating to health equity in our service area preferred.Able to meet deadlines, multi-task, and work within time constraints.

Apply now Apply later

* Salary range is an estimate based on our AI, ML, Data Science Salary Index üí∞
